com.peterverzijl.softwaresystems.qwirkle

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.peterverzijl.softwaresystems.qwirkle.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The playing field of the Qwirkle game.
    Version:
    1.0a
    Author:
    Peter Verzijl en Dennis Vinke.

    • Field Detail

      • borders

        public static int[] borders
        A list to track the extreme positions of the board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructor for the board.

    • Method Detail

      • moveStringToNode

        public static Node moveStringToNode(java.lang.String message)
        Reads a move string and converts this to a node.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to convert to a node.
        Returns:
        A node with the correct location and block assigned to it, based on the given string.\n It is used to convert MOVE server messages to moves the game understands.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(java.util.List<Node> aListOfMoves)
        Checks if a move a Player does is valid by checking if all blocks of a move are placed in the same row and if the color or the shape is the same according to the rules. Looks at the last stone of a set for the correctness of the nodes because of the fact that every stone is placed one for one on the board and every placed stone is checked. (If k+1 == true, k is also true).
        Parameters:
        aListOfMoves - Checks a list of moves on validity.
        Returns:
        True if all the checks are passed and thus the move is valid.

      • createEmptyNode

        public Node createEmptyNode(Direction aDirection,
                            Node aBlock)
        Creates an empty node in a certain direction used to expand the board.
        Parameters:
        aDirection - The direction in which to create an empty node.
        aBlock - The node relative to the direction.
        Returns:
        A new node placed at the direction of a node which both are defined as parameters.

      • findDuplicateNode

        public Node findDuplicateNode(Vector2 aPosition,
                              Direction aDirection)
        Searches the frontier list of empty nodes for a node with the same position. Placed nodes do not have to be checked because they are not legible to place a stone.
        Parameters:
        aPosition - The x and y pair to find the duplicate stone off.
        aDirection - The direction to look from the given x, y coordinate.
        Returns:
        The duplicate node if it exists else it will return null

      • printNodeList

        public static void printNodeList(java.util.List<Node> aNodeList)
        Prints the list of empty nodes to the console.
        Parameters:
        aNodeList - The list of nodes to print.

      • isValidColor

        public boolean isValidColor(Node lastMove,
                            Direction aDirection)
        Looks if the color requirement is fulfilled by checking all the neighbor node, in all possible Directions.
        Parameters:
        lastMove - The last node placed on the board.
        aDirection - The direction to check for color correctness.
        Returns:
        true if all the neighbors in aDirection are the same and no duplicate char exists in row.

      • isValidShape

        public boolean isValidShape(Node aMove,
                            Direction aDirection)
        Looks if the shape requirement is fulfilled by checking all the neighbor node, in all possible Directions.
        Parameters:
        aMove - The last node placed on the board.
        aDirection - The direction to check for shape correctness.
        Returns:
        true if all the neighbors in aDirection are the same and no duplicate char exists in row

      • getPlacedBlocks

        public java.util.List<Node> getPlacedBlocks()
        Getter for all blocks placed on the board.
        Returns:
        A list of all placed blocks on the board.

      • setEmptySpaces

        public void setEmptySpaces(java.util.List<Node> aNewEmptySpaceList)
        Setter for empty spaces on the board. First clears the frontier, then adds all new empty spaces to the fronteir.
        Parameters:
        aNewEmptySpaceList - The new frontier.

      • getEmptySpaces

        public java.util.List<Node> getEmptySpaces()
        Makes a copy of the empty spaces and returns the copy list.
        Returns:
        a copy of the empty nodes TODO(Dennis): Plz fx yo!

      • removeFrontier

        public void removeFrontier(Node aBlock)
        Searches for the node in the list with possible moves and removes it.
        Parameters:
        aBlock - Removes a block with the same position from the frontier.

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.util.List<Node> aListOfPlacedBlocks,
                                        java.util.List<Node> aListOfPossibleMoves)
        Prints a string representation of the current state of the board.
        Parameters:
        aListOfPlacedBlocks - The list of placed blocks to convert to a stirng.
        aListOfPossibleMoves - The list of possible moves to convert to a stirng.
        Returns:
        A string of the whole board.

      • setFrontier

        public void setFrontier(Node aPlacedNode)
        Adds a node to the empty node list.
        Parameters:
        aPlacedNode - Adds the node to the frontier.

      • addFrontiers

        public void addFrontiers(Node aNode)
        Checks if the node already has a neighbor node exists. If not it is checked if an empty node already exists and sets the neighbors accordingly Else create a new neighbor node.
        Parameters:
        aNode - The node to add to the frontier.

      • setPlacedBlock

        public boolean setPlacedBlock(Node node)
        Sets a block if the position of the node that has to be added is also the position of a node in the empty node list Else the move is invalid.
        Parameters:
        node - The node containing the block and the position to place the block at.
        Returns:
        False if the position of node does not exists in the empty nodes list

      • setStone

        public boolean setStone(Node node)
        Updates the empty nodes list if the setPlacedBlock(node) == true.
        Parameters:
        node - The stone and position to set on the board.
        Returns:
        return true if a stone placed is placed on a valid spot

      • setStones

        public void setStones(java.util.List<Node> aNodeList)
               throws IllegalMoveException
        Makes a copy of the placedBlock list and empty spaces list. If the move was valid, changes to the placedBlock list and empty spaces lists are kept else the list is reverted back to the state when the copies are made
        Parameters:
        aNodeList - A list of moves that are to be placed on the board.
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - Thrown when an invalid move is done.

      • giveHint

        public java.util.List<Node> giveHint(java.util.List<Node> possibleMoves,
                                     java.util.List<Node> currentSet,
                                     Block aBlock)
        Fills in a block to find out which positions offer a valid move.
        Parameters:
        possibleMoves - A list of all possible moves.
        currentSet - A list of all currently held blocks in the hand.
        aBlock - The block to fill in as a hint.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of valid moves the player could do.

      • calcScore

        public int calcScore(Node aBlock)
        Calculates the score of the last stone placed. This is done by calculation all the stones found in the horizontal, and vertical lines of this block
        Parameters:
        aBlock - The block to check the score of.
        Returns:
        The amount of blocks placed in a line.

      • isValidConnected

        public boolean isValidConnected(java.util.List<Node> aListOfBlock)
        Looks if the all the blocks in aListOfBlocks can be reached by accasing the neighbors going strictly left and right or up and down.
        Parameters:
        aListOfBlock - All stones placed in this turn.
        Returns:
        true if copylist is empty and no blocks found in x or y direction

      • boardScale

        public void boardScale(Vector2 aPosition)
        Scales the board based on the extreme positions found during the game.
        Parameters:
        aPosition - Scales the board with a certain scale. X is width and y is height of the scaling.
